TextView.android:text: 1)Cool the skin with running cool or tepid water for at least 10 minutes. This will prevent the burn getting worse.

2)Do not use ice, iced water, creams, or greasy substances (such as butter) to soothe the burn. 

3)Remove any clothes or jewellery from around the burn, unless they are sticking to it. 

4)Cover the burn using strips of cling film, rather than wrapping it around a limb. A clean plastic bag is suitable to use for burns on your hand. 

5)If the burn is painful, taking a mild painkiller, such as paracetamol or ibuprofen, can help. 

6)Do not interfere with the burn, or break any blisters. If the burn is very painful, or seems to be getting worse, call an ambulance.
